comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: The 27th of February 1955 was the first day of electric train services to Blacktown. However, celebrations were somewhat premature as the Government had neglected to order enough rolling stock in advance to provide a full electrified service. Passengers had to wait several more years. They had already waited since the 1930s when agitation for electrification began, and after early soothing assurances, were later told "it would be quite impracticable". It is likely the Premier, Mr. J. J. Cahill, officially opened the line, as he did at Mt Druitt later that year.
